official-title.#text:
To amend the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act to
		  provide that Alexander Creek, Alaska, is and shall be recognized as an eligible
		  Native village under that Act, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following:

text.#text:
Subject to the limitations of this section
				and notwithstanding

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and any conveyance or agreement in
				furtherance thereof or thereto, to the contrary, Alexander Creek, located
				within Township 15N, Range 7W, Seward Meridian, Alaska, is and shall be
				recognized as an eligible Native village under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1432(d) of the Alaska National Interest Lands
				Conservation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act/s:1432/ss:d

header.#text:
Recognition of
				the village of Alexander Creek

text.#text:
For
				the purposes of this section, the following terms apply:

any
				instrumentality of the United States;

any element of an
				agency; and

any wholly owned
				or mixed-owned corporation of the United States Government identified in

term.#tail:
means
				Alexander Creek, Incorporated, an Alaska Native Group corporation organized
				pursuant to this Act prior to the enactment of this section, but subsequent to
				enactment of this section means Alexander Creek, Incorporated, an Alaska Native
				Village corporation recognized and organized pursuant to

means Cook Inlet Region Incorporated, an Alaska Native
				Regional Corporation, which is the appropriate Regional Corporation for
				Alexander Creek under

text.#text:
As soon as practicable after enactment of this
				section, Alexander Creek shall cause to be filed—

any amendments to
				its corporate charter in the State of Alaska necessary to convert from a Native
				group to a Native Village corporation; and

if necessary, any
				amendments to its corporate charter and governing business documents that
				fulfill the terms of the agreement authorized under this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall open discussions and
				subsequently negotiate and, in the

sole discretion on behalf of the
				United States, enter into an agreement within one year of enactment of this
				section, with Alexander Creek to fairly and equitably settle aboriginal land
				claims and any other claims of Alexander Creek against the United States; and
				such agreement with Alexander Creek shall be in approximate value parity with
				those of other Alaska Native Village Corporations, notwithstanding Alexander
				Creek’s prior status as a Group Corporation.

text.#text:
Not later than 30 days after the date of
				enactment of this section, the

A settlement
				reached under this subsection shall not be subject to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Indian Tribal
				Judgment Funds Use or Distribution Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Indian Tribal Judgment Funds Use or Distribution Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and that all future resource
				payments from the Region shall be made to the Village Corporation pursuant to

. The Region shall not be liable under any State, Federal, or local
				law, or under State or Federal common law, for damages arising out of or
				related to the cessation of payments to such individuals under

text.#text:
Alexander Creek shall notify each member of the
				Native village recognized under this section that, upon the effective date of
				this section, such members shall cease to receive benefits from the Region as
				at-large shareholders pursuant to

Except
				as provided in this section with respect to Alexander Creek, nothing in this
				section shall be construed to modify or amend land conveyance entitlements or
				conveyance agreements between the Region and village corporations other than
				Alexander Creek in such region, nor between the Region and the Federal
				Government, nor between any such parties and the State of Alaska.

Nothing in this section
				shall be construed to reduce the land entitlement to which Alexander Creek
				became entitled as a Group Corporation, including the land selected by and
				conveyed to Alexander Creek at the time of enactment of this
				section.

header.#text:
Construction
				regarding current Alexander Creek land
